title: Imelda Marcos
summary: Imelda Romualdez Marcos[4] (Tagalog pronunciation: [ɪˈmelda ˈmaɾkɔs]; born Imelda Remedios Visitacion Trinidad Romualdez; July 2, 1929) is a Filipina politician and convicted criminal  who was First Lady of the Philippines for 21 years,[5] during which she and her husband Ferdinand Marcos stole billions[6][7]: 176  from the Filipino people,[8][9][10] amassing a personal fortune estimated to have been worth US$5 billion to US$10 billion by the time they were deposed in 1986.[11][12][13] By 2018, about $3.6 billion of this had been recovered by the Philippine government,[14][15] either through compromise deals or sequestration cases.[9][16]
